title: PII data Leakage through hackerone reports

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
##Summary:

I found PII data leakage through the HackerOne report. I found a link in one of the disclosed report that allow me to get the address and phone numbers of security researchers. Here I got the address and phone number of ████ (███)


Vulnerability Name: PII data Leakage through

##Steps to reproduce:
—>Just visit ███
—>You will find a link swag link there.  (Refer: Screenshot 1)
—>Now visit the swag link ie. ██████████ and add a parameter there ██████████ 
—> link becomes : ████████
—>You will get the PII of researchers.  (Refer: Screenshot 2)

##Fix
1.)████████ should be informed that the data might have leaked. 
2.)Link should be redacted.
3.) When hackerone provides swag to researchers they should mention to keep the link strictly confidential , 
same information should also be provided to the programs on HackerOne , that offer swag.

## Impact

An attacker can get sensitive information about the other researchers like their addresses and phone number.

activities.message:
Also I want to add in this , Recently I was offered swag from hackerone,in the message it was'nt mentioned that the link is supposed be treated as secret and not be dislosed, this also led to my phone number and address disclosure.
████████
The link is supposed to be secret, This should be mentioned every time hackerone rewards swags 
Thank you.

Hi @iamr0000t,

Thank you for your submission. I hope you are well. Your report is currently being reviewed and the HackerOne triage team will get back to you once there is additional information to share.

Have a great day! 

Kind regards,
@forest_dweller

Hey @iamr0000t,

Thank you for your report!

After review, there doesn’t seem to be any security risk and/or security impact as a result of the behavior you are describing.

This is a vulnerability affecting █████████'s website and should be reported to them. The link by itself does not reveal the researcher's information. It is the addition of the extra parameter `█████████` that causes the website to reveal the user's information.

As a result, we will be closing this report as informative. If you are able to leverage this into a practical exploitation scenario, we will be happy to reevaluate this report.

This will not have any impact on your Signal or Reputation score. We appreciate your effort and look forward to seeing more reports from you in the future.

Kind regards,
@forest_dweller

Hello, When HackerOne rewards swag, HackerOne fails to mention that the link is supposed to be treated as Secret so this is a vulnerability on HackerOne's part rather than the swag partner ███████. 
Here data of PII data is leaked via third party due to HackerOne , there is no vulnerability in █████████ as the link can not be bruteforced however while rewarding swag, HackerOne should mention that the link is not to be shared even after delivery of swag or in disclosed report. 
Kindly read the last comments and reconsider . 
Thanks

Hi @iamr0000t - thanks for following up. We don't believe that this is a HackerOne vulnerability, but we'd like to use this opportunity to coordinate the vulnerability to ██████ and work with them to properly remediate this. In the meantime, HackerOne will consider a number of actions to ensure people know that a ██████ URL is sensitive and may lead to their name and address information being exposed. We'll get back to you when we've heard back from the vendor.

Hi @iamr0000t - ████████ got back to us that they pushed a fix for the problem. They now require someone to enter the email address that is associated with the order. It's currently unclear to me if this new release coincided with your report, I'm trying to figure that out. We're updating the severity to reflect the likelihood of this being exploited at scale. You happened to find someone else's ████ URL, but this is highly unlikely (unless I'm missing something). We're planning to make some changes to our process so people know that the URLs should be kept to themselves as well.

hello @jobert, Thanks for the quick response , 
there are few just questions on my mind ,
The reason i reported this issue was , I was recently rewarded swag 
From H1 for hitting 500 rep ,as I was able to see my details in incognito , it made look more into this , and I noticed HackerOne has not mentioned anywhere that this link is supposed to be private , so I believed thats an issue because I might have included the link on my writeup/twitter after getting the swag , If I wasn't carefull .Thats why I wanted H1 To always mention that the link is supposed to private while rewarding swag. 
   
The update from the vendor have made it a little more timeconsuming to crack but its not secure because by guessing email address of anyone , for example  ████ ie his hackerone username @ gmail.com
(█████████) I am still able to access the details such as Phone number , and shipping address etc.
(refer to screenshot below that is after entering email)
███


>>
We're updating the severity to reflect the likelihood of this being exploited at scale. You happened to find someone else's ███████ URL, but this is highly unlikely (unless I'm missing something). We're planning to make some changes to our process so people know that the URLs should be kept to themselves as well.

I agree that the probability of this being exploited at large scale is very less, However as I mentioned earlier I reported this because H1 didn't mentioned anywhere that the link is supposed to treated as a secret and also the 2nd reason was that ████████ is one of my favourite researchers, so I was overjoyed when I  saw his details through this issue. 

I also want to ask if this report is elegible for bounty, from my side I think it should be because to completely resolve this there are some changes required from HackerOne's side as well 

Thank you

Hi @iamr0000t - thanks for following up! I hear what you're saying. However, I believe that it's only the case because you know that the user ID belonged to ██████ to begin with. Not mentioning that the URLs are sensitive feels a bit implied, so I'm not super confident yet that we're considering that to be a security vulnerability, but I'll discuss it with a few others. Until then though, ████████ is very thankful about you reporting the security vulnerability and wanted to send you some swag. They gave me the following link: ████████. No worries, I don't have your email address, so I won't be able to see your address (haha). One thing the asked me to pass along: a user is only required to enter their email address again after 10 minutes have passed, so keep that in mind when retesting the vulnerability and checking out the new flow. Let me know if you have any feedback for them that you want me to pass along.

Hello, 
>> I don't have your email address, so I won't be able to see your address (haha).

haha you are 1337, most probably my password is in your wordlist xD :P

I understand that it might be implied and I am unable to find any other link leaked from a H1 researcher, other than the one i mentioned earlier,
but if you use a google dork ie "site:███████" in the results you will see different links getting indexed as they were leaked somewhere, for example I also managed to find a live one 
██████ 
(the swag hasn't shipped yet so I could have changed the delivery address I guess if the email wasn't required. )
thats why I think that H1 mentioning that link is supposed to be a secret will be better. 

Also for the program I want to say Thanks for the swag :) , The fix looks good.
**For the google Indexing issue they should use noindex metatag rather than adding a robots.txt file
beacuse this will work more efficiently for this particular scenario ie even if the links get leaked they won't get indexed.**
This will make the dork ineffective .
Additional Reference :https://developers.google.com/search/docs/advanced/crawling/block-indexing


Thanks

Hi @iamr0000t - thanks for pointing that out! I forwarded that feedback to ███ and they told me that they're planning to release a change that'll add the meta tag to prevent the pages being indexed. Great recommendation!

thats great, also I wanted to ask if the decision of bounty has been made. 
Thank you.

Also lets disclose this, after redacting the sensitive data .
Thanks

hello please redact the sensitive info and screenshots , Also there has been no updates regarding the swag shipment after I selected the swag 
Thanks.
Hi @iamr0000t - unfortunately, this vulnerability isn't eligible for a monetary reward because it was determined to be a low severity vulnerability in a HackerOne vendor.
Hi @iamr0000t - the vendor just notified us that they've pushed the update to avoid indexing of the pages as well.
